creator: eseidel@apple.com
text:
It would be great if apache could add 

application/x-quicktimeplayer   qtl

to the default conf/mime.types

This adds support for "Quicktime Link" files.  Currently, we patch our mime.types file at build time 
to add this directive, but it would be great if this could flow upstream.

This will effect all quicktime capable clients connecting to apache servers, as it will allow them to 
open quicktime links directly in quicktime player as opposed to just getting garbled text as they 
would now.  Many sites serve quicktime content from non-mac os boxes, and I imagine they would 
find this directive helpful in the default configuration.

creator: erik@codefaktor.de
text:
Our policy for additions to mime.types is listed here:
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_mime.html#typesconfig

Essentially, it says that we'll only add IANA registered types and
automatically reject types of the form category/x-subtype.

The media-type you mentioned falls in both categories. Please let us
know if it will become a registered type and we will consider adding it.

Thanks for using Apache.
